00013 void sivm_new(SIVM *sivm)
00014 {
00015     sivm->pc = PC_START;
00016     sivm->sp = SP_START;
00017     sivm->sr = SR_START;
00018         
00019         if (SP_START + SP_INCR > MEMSIZE || SP_START + SP_INCR <= 0)
00020                 logm("Stack init and incrementation are not in the same way, VM will crash at first push.", 0);
00021         
00022     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < NREGS; i++)
00023         sivm->reg[i] = 0;
00024     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < MEMSIZE; i++)
00025         sivm->mem[i].brut = 0;
00026         
00027         logm("VM successfully initialized.", 2);
00028 }
00029 
00033 bool sivm_load(SIVM *sivm, int memsize, cmd_word mem[memsize])
00034 {
00035         if (memsize > MEMSIZE) return false;
00036         
00037     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < memsize; i++)
00038         sivm->mem[i] = mem[i];
00039 
00040     return true;
00041 }

00055 bool checkMemoryAccess(REG index)
00056 {
00057         if (index > MEMSIZE) {
00058                 logm("Invalid memory access (too high!)", 0);
00059                 return false;
00060         }
00061         return true;
00062 }
00063 
00067 bool checkRegisterAccess(unsigned index)
00068 {
00069         if (index >= NREGS) {
00070                 logm("Invalid register access (too high!)", 0);
00071                 return false;
00072         }
00073         return true;
00074 }

00080 
00086 bool sivm_step(SIVM *sivm)
00087 {
00088         checkMemoryAccess(sivm->pc);
00089     cmd_word *m = &sivm->mem[sivm->pc];
00090 
00091     /* stop the vm */
00092     if (m->codage.codeop == HALT) {
00093                 logm("HALT instruction encountered, stopping VM.", 3);
00094         return false;
00095         }
00096         
00097     if (! sivm_exec(sivm, m)) return false;
00098 
00099         return increment_PC(sivm);
00100 }
00101 
00106 bool increment_PC(SIVM *sivm)
00107 {
00108         if (checkMemoryAccess(sivm->pc)) {
00109                 sivm->pc++;
00110                 return true;
00111         }
00112         logm("PC too high !", 0);
00113         return false;
00114 }
00115 
00123 REG* getDestinationParameter(SIVM *sivm, cmd_word *word)
00124 {
00125         mode destMode, srcMode;
00126         getModes(word, &destMode, &srcMode);
00127         
00128         switch (destMode) {
00129                 case REGISTER:
00130                         checkRegisterAccess(word->codage.dest);
00131                         return &sivm->reg[word->codage.dest];
00132                         break;
00133                 case IMMEDIATE:
00134                         logm("Invalid adressing mode: destination parameter can't be an immediate value!", 0);
00135                         return NULL;
00136                         break;
00137                 case DIRECT:
00138                         increment_PC(sivm);
00139                         checkMemoryAccess(sivm->mem[sivm->pc].brut);
00140                         return &(sivm->mem[sivm->mem[sivm->pc].brut].brut);
00141                         break;
00142                 case INDIRECT:
00143                         checkMemoryAccess(sivm->reg[word->codage.dest]);
00144                         return &(sivm->mem[sivm->reg[word->codage.dest]].brut);
00145                         break;
00146                 default:
00147                         logm("Invalid destination adressing mode", 0);
00148                         return NULL;
00149         }
00150 }
00151 
00159 cmd_word getSourceParameter(SIVM *sivm, cmd_word *word)
00160 {
00161         mode destMode, srcMode;
00162         getModes(word, &destMode, &srcMode);
00163         
00164         switch (srcMode) {
00165                 case REGISTER:
00166                         checkRegisterAccess(word->codage.dest);
00167                         return (cmd_word) sivm->reg[word->codage.source];
00168                         break;
00169                 case IMMEDIATE:
00170                         increment_PC(sivm);
00171                         return sivm->mem[sivm->pc];
00172                         break;
00173                 case DIRECT:
00174                         increment_PC(sivm);
00175                         checkMemoryAccess(sivm->mem[sivm->pc].brut);
00176                         return (cmd_word) sivm->mem[sivm->mem[sivm->pc].brut].brut;
00177                         break;
00178                 case INDIRECT:
00179                         checkMemoryAccess(sivm->reg[word->codage.dest]);
00180                         return sivm->mem[sivm->reg[word->codage.source]];
00181                         break;
00182                 default:
00183                         logm("Invalid source adressing mode", 0);
00184                         return (cmd_word) {.codage = { HALT }}; //Don't test for this value to detect errors, because it might also be a valid integer value
00185         }
00186 }
00187 
00195 bool sivm_exec(SIVM *sivm, cmd_word *word)
00196 {       
00197         Instr instr = getInstruction(*word);
00198         cmd_word source = getSourceParameter(sivm, word);
00199         REG *dest = getDestinationParameter(sivm, word);
00200         
00201         logm(instr.name, 5);
00202         if (instr.function(sivm, dest, source)) {
00203                 logm("Instruction successful", 5);
00204                 return true;
00205         } else {
00206                 logm("Instruction unsuccessful", 1);
00207                 return false;
00208         }
00209 }

00217 void sivm_status(SIVM *sivm)
00218 {
00219     printf("==> Status <==\n");
00220         printf("\tPC = %d\n", sivm->pc);
00221         printf("\tSR = %d\n", sivm->sr);
00222         printf("\tSP = %d\n", sivm->sp);
00223     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < NREGS; ++i)
00224         printf("\tREG[%d] = %d\n", i, sivm->reg[i]);
00225 }

00228 Instr sivm_get_instruction(SIVM *sivm)
00229 {
00230         checkMemoryAccess(sivm->pc);
00231         return getInstruction(sivm->mem[sivm->pc]);
00232 }
